column4: Hi, im having trouble with burning the ubuntu ISO, I have before without trouble but this time, it gets all the way done, but burn returns the error that it cannot fixate the disc, after which I can't eject the disc without resetting the computer, trying to gives me "cannot eject disc, input/output error", I've also tried burning it in k3b and gnomebaker, all times at 2x.
even though they all seemingly finish, I guess they dont fixate or whatever, they are all coasters, of course, failures, I'm on 9.10 by the way
yes, thats where i get the error
otherwise the drive is just unresponsive, flashing light on and off
the cd's? just bought them
I can burn audio cds just fine, actually just burned one
logs? where might i look?
rather, which logs I guess is what i should ask
have you tried to burn at console? "cdrecord -dao speed=8 -v foo.iso"
well I tried to burn it with "burn" thats synonymous with cdrecord right?
i don't know "burn", just cdrecord or of course its fork wodim
I usually just "sudo burn -I -n ubuntu.iso"
only logs i could imagine, /var/log/syslog(messages)
burn seems to be just another frontend to cdrdao/cdrecord, so it should work. maybe try to make it more verbos
to get a more descriptive error?
yes
call me crazy but this looks almost exactly the same http://ubuntuforums.org/archive/index.php/t-546504.html
use -rw
its not a rw disc?
? i always recommend cd-rw media for live-cd/install-cds, because you only need it once. don't waste cd-r media for that
i dont have any r'w media, im not sure i have a burner anyways
i doubt that it would fix your problem, but makes testing cheaper
